entry.title: SAP Data and Analytics Forum 18.-19.11.2025
entry.content:
We look forward to welcoming  you on the 18th to 19th. November at this year’s German speaking SAP Data and Analytics Forum. An exciting program with inspiring lectures awaits you.  

There are two ways to participate in the event:  

Option 1: You only visit the first day, in virtual format  

 The first day is free and virtual. Current trends and developments in Data and Analytics are discussed here. From best practices to new technologies and applications such as SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Datasphere, you will be able to gain valuable insights and expand your knowledge.  Key sessions will cover the strategic direction and roadmap of the SAP Business Data Cloud, highlight the latest innovations and feature enhancements, and explore advanced planning capabilities enabled by seamless planning.

Sign up here for the first free and virtual day.

 Option 2: Join Both Days in Walldorf or Virtually

 The second day will be delivered in a hybrid format, enabling participation either on site at the SAP Training Center in Walldorf or virtually. Building on the strategic and technological perspectives from day one, you will dive deeper into SAP’s data and analytics portfolio. Through expert-led sessions and live demonstrations, you will explore the SAP Business Data Cloud in detail – from its architecture and native data warehousing capabilities with SAP Datasphere to its integration with SAP Enterprise Architecture Designer, SAP Data Hub, SAP Embedded Analytics, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Intelligent Applications.

Between sessions, “Meet the Expert” formats give you the opportunity to address your specific technical and business questions directly with SAP specialists.

You will also have the chance to join a guided tour of the SAP Experience Center, illustrating sustainable value creation across an end-to-end solution landscape, and discover the SAP S.Mart Store as a real-world example of applied retail innovation.

The day will close with an evening networking event – the perfect opportunity to exchange ideas, share experiences, and build valuable connections in a relaxed setting.

Register now for the 2-day SAP Data and Analytics Forum and secure 25% off your next SAP Certification. After registration, you will receive a discount voucher for the SAP certification exam, valid for two attempts.

Sign up for the SAP Data and Analytics Forum right here. (preliminary Agenda) 

SIX Product and Solution Learning,  
Data & Analytics Team

entry.title: Re: what is the purpose of SSP percentage in FARR_D_POB t...
entry.content:
Hi Murtyraju,

SSP percentage is used for tolerance calculation. Instead of assigning a SSP tolerance amount, it is also possible to define a percentage. System will calculate the SSP range accordingly, e.g. low SSP = SSP  * (1- SSP percentage), high SSP = SSP * (1 + SSP percentage).

Such formula can be checked in below part of the official RAR documentation:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_REVENUE_ACCOUNTING_AND_REPORTING/17fec0d77e324d78b2a37af97bdef898/53778499c9c64903a521ef178a379207.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST 

Kind Regards,

Gonzalo

SAP Support

entry.title: How to build a compelling case for your skills transformation journey
entry.content:
Join SAP experts Andrey Kulikov, HR Value Advisor, and Rebecca Reagan-Thieme, Senior Solution Value Advisor, to learn about how to create a case for the value of building skills into your HR processes. Rebecca will talk about finding compelling problems to solve, we'll cover which KPIs you might aim to improve with a skills transformation, and Andrey will talk about how Value Advisory can help you support your case with concrete ROI and other metrics.

You must register using the link to the right in order to access the webinar.

entry.title: Upgrade Tools & Resources - New Enterprise Support Advisory Council Pilot for Customers
entry.content:
Greetings SAP Community! 

Big news! At the beginning in Q4 2025, SAP Enterprise Support will provide a new pilot through the SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council (ESAC) focusing on the upgrades for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition customers.

 

Quick Links

 

Scope

We recognize that system upgrades can present challenges, such as downtime and adapting to new features. Tackling these issues head-on is essential to enhancing your upgrade experience.

Our primary goal is to empower you with the right tools and resources to manage your release readiness during upgrades. A streamlined upgrade process will allow you to unlock new functionalities and minimize potential disruptions. 

We will also introduce you to the release navigator, design to help you leverage SAP enablement resources, ensuring successful and beneficial upgrades for your business. This tool offers more than just guidance—it provides tangible resources tailored to your system landscape, including:

  • An overview of the release process, upgrade frameworks, and innovation roadmaps to guide your decision-making for SAP release planning and technical readiness.

 

Prerequisites

To fully benefit from the release navigator, there are a few prerequisites you'll need:

  • Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition system should be operational.
  • You should have completed at least one upgrade project or cycle.
  • Make sure you have a dedicated contact person available for communication and coordination.

 

Outcome

You’ll have access to a dedicated SAP Release Advisor, remote sessions, and self-service enablement tools ensuring you have the support you need every step of the way. After completion of this workstream, you will be well informed about the tools and resources available to support your upgrade process. We will also spend time identifying common pain points with upgrades and how SAP can better support these challenges.

 

Participation

  • This pilot is brought to you via the SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council (ESAC).
  • To find out more about the SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council in general visit the website. 
  • Details of this workstream will soon be included on that page.
  • To register you interest please contact us via email: esac@sap.com:
    • Let us know your location / timezone, and state your interest in this pilot workstream.

entry.title: Pin drop in Philly
entry.content:
Since @StephanieMarley asked if we had a good time in Philadelphia after the Inside Track get-together at Newtown Square, I decided to share images and data manipulation related to Center City.

Openstreetmap.org allows user edits of geotagged data, similar to Wikipedia, and I've been contributing content such as EV charger details, public artwork (conceptual continuity), and, the most complex, public transport Metadata.

Here's one view:

OpenStreetMap edit screen with Panoramax inset

I took the image in Arch Street and 21st, then uploaded it to Panoramax.  You can see the yellow cone of shame where my camera GPS slightly wrongly placed the capture point.

Panoramax is open source imagery hosted mainly in France. I'm am early adopter so areas I cover have no prior images.

Instead of a sequence that I might do on a walk, I just pushed the one image in the thumbnail to Panoramax. The other side of the sign doesn't say nothing, it says the same thing. Exactly I think, though the blue patch seems like an edit (like a blue pencil moment).

Stop 3092, obverse.

I kind of like that identification number is abbreviated with 2 poitns: I.D.

Adding the missing bus stop to OpenStreetMap took a bit of study so as not to go around the local norms, if any. Bad updates can be rolled back or written over; not screwing it up the 1st time helps. 

OSM with a wide Panoramax view.

After my edits started, OSM came back with a message "these are the tags you are looking for", thus simplifying my entry time. I found stop 3092 by searching the Septa.org site, as follows:

Screenshot of bus route 48, Market to Allegheny, SEPTA

Note the route number (48) in the URL. After some mind bending, I found the relevant URL with the stop number embedded.

Screenshot from SEPTA with stop 3092, 21st and Arch flagged as a pin point.

See: https://www.septa.org/realtime-map/stop/3092?routes=48&focused=48&direction=1 , at least until the next database rewrite.

Happy trails!

entry.title: Re: Grouping Multiple Dunning Letters into a Single Notice
entry.content: Hello - In S/4HANA Cloud, dunning notices are created per Business Partner, but a “Custom Output Form” approach allows limited consolidation at the presentation layer. The concept is to intervene at the Adobe Form template level, merging multiple notices into one output document. This involves two layers. First, Output Parameter Determination (OPD) cannot override the one-BP-per-notice rule, but it can apply custom conditions such as clerk ID, BP group, or company code to route multiple notices to the same form template variant. This ensures grouping is controlled at the output stage. Second, the Adobe Form itself can be extended to include logic that loops through multiple notices, printing them together. For instance, instead of generating separate notices for each BP, the form can gather all notices belonging to the same clerk and render them in a single letter. However, in Public Cloud, the underlying data source is fixed, so partner development (via a CDS view extension or BAdI) may be needed to expose multi-BP data. Technically, the process requires copying the standard template, extending the data source, adjusting OPD rules, and enhancing the form to display one header with all relevant BP items, simulating “one letter per clerk.”

entry.title: Re: Introducing SAP HANA Cloud on SAP Cloud Infrastructure
entry.content:
Great questions! Let me try to answer:

1. Migration from AWS to SCI: You can use a template-based system copy. Create a cloning template of your SAP HANA database and store it in an HDL File container, which can be made available across cloud service providers and regions. For details, check:

    • API-based process (2023/QRC1): Create and Use a Cloning Template Using the CLI | SAP Help Portal
    • UI-based process (2023/QRC3): Clone an SAP HANA Database Instance | SAP Help Portal

2. BTP subaccount in EU01: EU01 (Frankfurt/SCI) is only available to customers who have purchased EU Access. Please check with your account executive whether you are entitled to use it.

entry.title: Re: Text field data is showing in entry and not showing i...
entry.content:
Hi @Dasun_T ,

I think this is more of update issue.

 

-If the line item text was entered at document creation but later changed, FBL5N may not immediately refresh unless you run the report with “Refresh” or Rebuild Indexes (program RFSEPA01 / SAPF190).
-FBL5N uses index tables (BSID/BSAD), not BSEG directly.
-If indexes are inconsistent, texts appear blank.
-Use RFSEPA01 (for both open/cleared) or SAPF190 (for cleared items) to rebuild.
-Always run in background and preferably restricted by account/company code.

-RFSEPA01: Rebuilds customer, vendor, and G/L index tables (open and cleared items) to fix missing data in FBL5N reports; run via SE38/SA38 with test run first, then background execution.
-SAPF190: Rebuilds only cleared item indexes for customers, vendors, or G/L; run via SE38/SA38, suitable for small data in foreground or large volumes in background.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Rethinking Product Compliance – How SAP S/4HANA Helps Companies Stay Globally Marketable
entry.content:
In today’s rapidly evolving regulatory environment, companies are increasingly challenged to ensure that their products are not just safe, but also legally marketable in all target regions. With complex and varying regulations like REACH in the EU or TSCA in the U.S., compliance has become more than a legal necessity. It’s now a strategic business priority.

In this video, I walk through how SAP S/4HANA for Product Compliance supports organizations in meeting these challenges efficiently and proactively.

Instead of treating compliance as a siloed process, SAP integrates it directly into the core business operations—from product development and master data management to sales and logistics. Automated compliance checks, embedded regulatory content, and powerful analytic tools make it possible to shift from reactive risk management to proactive product governance.

What is the Video about:

  • Why compliance is more than just a legal obligation
  • How SAP S/4HANA automates compliance processes across your value chain
  • How to reduce regulatory risk while accelerating time-to-market
  • And how compliance can become a true competitive differentiator

This topic is especially important to me because I believe that compliance—when done right—is not a bottleneck, but a growth enabler. It builds trust, opens markets, and future-proofs your operations.

SAP Video - In brief: SAP Product Compliance - Product Marketability

Check out the video and let’s start a conversation about how SAP S/4HANA can help turn compliance into a business driver rather than a business blocker.

SAP S/4HANA for product compliance

entry.title: Tracking scope3 emissions using SAP SDX
entry.content:
Sustainability has become one of the defining leadership challenges of our time. It is no longer a reporting obligation but a factor that shapes competitiveness, investor confidence, and the trust of customers and communities. Many companies have already made progress by reducing the emissions they control directly through their operations (Scope 1) and their purchased energy (Scope 2). The harder truth is that most of the impact lies elsewhere. Scope 3 emissions created across supply chains, logistics, travel, and end use of products often account for more than 70 percent of a company’s total footprint.

Because they sit outside direct control, these emissions are often underreported and overlooked. Yet leaving them unaddressed carries serious consequences: exposure to new regulations, declining ESG scores, and loss of stakeholder trust. The path forward is clear. Businesses must extend responsibility beyond their own walls, working with partners, suppliers, and customers to create transparency and accountability across the value chain.

Following are the key challenges for businesses committed to sustainability for scope3 emissions:

  • Trust and Verification: Gathering comprehensive and accurate data from across the value chain is a difficult task. Companies must access multiple suppliers, each with their own reporting standards and capabilities, making the consolidation and verification of data a significant hurdle.
  •  Standardization: Without standardized metrics and reporting frameworks, comparing emissions data across suppliers or industry benchmarks becomes challenging. This lack of standardization hampers the ability of businesses to make informed decisions regarding their supply chain practices. 
  • Accurate Data collection: In an era where greenwashing is a growing concern, establishing the credibility of reported emissions data is paramount. Companies need mechanisms to verify the authenticity and accuracy of the data they receive to ensure it truly reflects their environmental impact.

SAP SDX for Scope 3 Emissions Management

The SAP Sustainability Data Exchange solution addresses above challenges and allows to exchange ‘Scope 3’ product footprint data with supply chain partners. The exchange of footprint data allows organizations to move away from using averages and estimates and use primary data instead. As a result, it helps companies to increase the data accuracy of their footprint calculations.

Some of the key product features for SDX are listed below :

Sno

Feature

Description

1

Exchange footprint data with supply chain partners

SAP Sustainability Data Exchange enables the exchange of product footprint data between partners. For purchased products, footprint data can be requested and received from connected suppliers. For sold products, footprint data can be sent to connected customers

2

Review and manage footprint data

SAP Sustainability Data Exchange allows you to review and manage your received (from suppliers) or calculated footprint data.

3

Integrate footprint data to and from other business applications

SAP Sustainability Data Exchange supports the integration of product footprint data to and from other business applications. Footprint data received from suppliers can be distributed to other applications (for example, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management). Similarly, footprint data can be imported and sent to customers.

SAP SDX enables data exchange by requesting and sharing carbon data. It achieves following advantages while exchanging data across supply chain:

Collaboration: It enables sharing of actual product carbon footprints (PCF) across value chains with increased interoperability and data sovereignty of data owners

Standardization: It simplifies audits with standardized data models and workflows and exchange information seamlessly following industry frameworks and requirements

Carbon reduction: It Identifies products or processes with high potential for CO2 reduction, avoid double emissions counting and optimize footprints

Industry specific Solutions: It enables industry specific extensions with WBCSD for e.g. adoptions of the Catena-X data model as an accepted PACT data model for automotive

SAP Sustainability Data Exchange is open for everyone across complex supply chains. Some of its unique integrations are:

  • Cloud-based solution with open APIs
  • Independent of company size
  • Industry agnostic
  • Interoperability: Communicate and exchange data with different systems and programs

Conclusion

In today's rapidly evolving world, the Energy and Utilities Industry are at the forefront of addressing sustainability challenges. With a strong commitment to reducing carbon footprints and minimizing emissions, the industry is taking significant strides towards a greener future. Emissions, particularly greenhouse gases, are a major concern as they are released during activities such as emissions from purchased goods such as manufacturing equipment, solar panels, wind turbines, and other components used in energy production. Additionally, emissions from losses in power grids and pipelines during delivery contribute significantly to scope 3 emissions. By leveraging innovative solutions and technologies, the Energy and Utilities Industry is poised to make a substantial impact in mitigating these environmental challenges and achieving their sustainability goals.

As Energy and Utilities industry are gearing up to tackle these challenges, TCS, which is a strategic partner of SAP, could help them tackle these challenges with the help of SAP SDX . TCS, which is a technology consulting firm, would help industry in setting up the systems, enabling the required data transfers into the systems through SAP SDX - achieve sustainable supply chains by requesting and sharing carbon data.

entry.title: Re: Error on GR for PO in previous Fiscal. GR only possib...
entry.content:
The screen shot you attached is unreadable and hence, not sure, what exactly the issue is. But in general, Goods Receipts must always be posted with a posting date in the current open fiscal year. Even if the purchase order delivery date falls in the previous year, the posting date used in the GR must be in the current year. If you use a prior‑year posting date, the system will attempt to post into a closed fiscal year. Since the prior year is already closed and balances have been carried forward, this will result in a system error (dump) and the GR cannot be completed.
When creating a GR in MIGO (or the Fiori app), always ensure the Posting Date field reflects a date in the current fiscal year. The Delivery Date on the PO can remain in the past; this does not block the GR.

entry.title: Re: Loop/Iterate in the SAP Build Process Autoamtion Proc...
entry.content:
Hello,

It is a bit late but maybe it will be helpful for other colleagues in the future.

You can have a variable with the number of iterations (maxloop) required and another variable with a counter = 0. Then create a branch with condition counter =< maxloop. 

In the if section you can make the action or call another process, increase the counter=+1 and then make a "go to" to check the branch condition again.

See a small screenshot before:

Hope it helps

Best regards

Javier

I Highly suggest checking the information present inside the help portal regarding Form 347, since all the configuration pre-requisites alongside other Document and Reporting Compliance topics can be found there:

  • Form 347: Incoming Cash Transactions | SAP Help Portal

 

I hope this helps!

For any other topics, feel free to reach out!

entry.title: From Strategy to Impact: TQM Multiplier Week 2025 Highlights
entry.content:
From Strategy to Impact: TQM Multiplier Week 2025 Highlights

Thank you to everyone who made the TQM Multiplier Week 2025 at SAP headquarters in Walldorf, Germany, a success. From September 15–19, 49 TQMs nominated from 30 market units came together to connect as a community, engage with SAP leadership, and co-create how we elevate premium engagements and bring SAP MaxAttention value to customers. The participating TQMs were selected for their exceptional performance over the past year, recognizing their leading contributions to customer success. They discovered how to translate strategy into customer impact across diverse strategic topics such as SAP Business AI, SAP Business Data Cloud, enterprise architecture and integrated toolchain,  and how to actively shape the future of the evolving TQM role.

They joined enablement sessions and deep-dive breakouts that sparked discussions on how to best apply new insights in their customer engagements. Driving consistent value delivery, prioritizing responsible AI use cases and identifying adoption patterns and integration scenarios for data-driven outcomes were among the key takeaways. In open Q&A sessions with SAP leaders, they had the chance to ask questions and address existing challenges, while the week fostered connections across our global TQM community.

Voices from the week
“The role of the TQM is established for many, many years as the key trusted advisor for the customer in any kind of situation. Now, it is a perfect time with the new Success Plans to really take the leap from safeguarding to game-changing, covering the entire landscape for the customer, guiding them and being their fitness coach.”
– Anja Schneider, SVP and Global Head of Premium Engagement & Advisory

“This is the best event I have ever had in my 25 years of SAP life. Not only a valuable input we received from the team, but also, we are now very much motivated with the interaction among worldwide TQMs. I am sure each of us will bring this strong momentum to our own regions, to leverage TQM team.”
– Shiro Nishimura, TQM APAC (Japan)

“Beyond learning and reinforcing the topics that SAP is addressing as part of its strategy, we also connected as a team and built friendships.”
– Andrea Chacon, TQM Americas (LAC)

A big thank-you to our speakers, facilitators, and SAP leadership for their time and insights, and to every TQM who brought energy, rigor, and customer focus to the week. Your contributions are shaping the future of premium engagements and amplifying the impact of SAP MaxAttention for our customers.

entry.title: Re: Question on Scope Item 4GQ – Event-Based Revenue Reco...
entry.content:
The system has flagged your WBS element for re‑evaluation. The error is not a misconfiguration; it is asking you to manually trigger re‑evaluation. This happens when:

  • A prior revenue recognition run ended with an error, or
  • A source document (sales order, PO, time confirmation, etc.) triggered a revenue recognition event that could not be processed in real time (e.g. runtime too long).

Instead of failing silently, the system creates a re‑evaluation request. Until you process that request, the project cannot be updated with revenue recognition postings.

To fix this, in Fiori, search for Reevaluate Revenue Recognition – Projects, enter your project/WBS element (P19-12110) and ledger (0L with accounting principle JPAP), Execute the re‑evaluation. This recalculates the recognition values and clears the pending request. After re‑evaluation, open this app again. You should now see the recognition postings generated for your project. Once the re‑evaluation is complete, you can execute the period‑end run again. This should now post the revenue and cost of sales entries.

entry.title: Re: New Developer Forums!
entry.content:

ABAP Development - SAP Community

entry.title: Re: Service organization missing some plants
entry.content:
The root cause for your issue is

For a plant to appear in the Maintain Service Organization app when you combine both a Sales Org and a Purchasing Org, the system checks two separate assignments:

Sales Org – Distribution Channel – Plant assignment - this you have already maintained.

Standard Purchasing Organization – Plant assignment This is the critical one. If the plant is not linked to a standard purchasing organization, it will not show up in the plant dropdown when you try to create or extend a service org.

SAP has documented this in SAP note 2696536

Could you please clarify related to the Android.

entry.title: Re: BTP Cloud Foundry trial - InsufficientResources - Ins...
entry.content:
I was facing the same "Insufficient Resources - Insufficient resources" error when trying to deploy apps (Node.js, CAP, or HANA) to my BTP trial account. After trying a few things, what finally worked was retrying the deployment with force using the following command:

cf deploy gen/mta.tar -f --retries 3

entry.title: Re: SAP’s New Cryptographic Library “CommonCryptoLib”
entry.content:
If replace the SAP Common Crypto Lib on a HANA instance using the HANA Local Secure Store by a newer version, the follwing error can occur:

3099050  - Local Secure Store (LSS) Denies the Connection with the Error "Library 'xxx' not found in any product"

entry.title: Make sold-to party changeable
entry.content:
Dear,

Is it possible to make the partner function '00000001 – Sold-To Party (CRM)' changeable using the configuration activity 'Define Partner Determination Procedure in Service' (ID: 105550)? I'm trying to modify the partner determination procedure SVO10001 (SAP Service Header) but I cannot change the 'changeable' flag.

Regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Make sold-to party changeable
entry.content:
Hello,

Currently, you cannot change the entry SVO10001 because it's a SAP entry.

However, you can create a custom entry, by creating a new entry or copying an existing entry, and then modify it as you wish. You can select the partners you want to include on the determination procedure, and decide their attributes, e.g. mandatory and changeable.

Note: remember that after creating a new partner determination procedure, you need to assign it to the document types which you want to use this new procedure.

Kind regards.

entry.title: Issue with Cost Center linked to incorrect Profit Center in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3SL, CBC)
entry.content:
Dear SAP community,

We are working with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3SL, CBC) and created a cost center ES015393 in the Manage Cost Centers Fiori app. During its creation, it was accidentally linked to the wrong profit center ES015394.

SAP Support advised us to:

  • Create a new cost center and link it to the correct profit center. 

  • Align the valid-from date of the new cost center with the valid-to date of the incorrect one. 

However, this did not resolve the issue.

Problem:

When creating new asset postings for the corrected cost center, we face the error: “Cost center has different profit centers; therefore it cannot be used.”

This happens when creating a fixed asset and filling the cost center field in the Manage Fixed Assets app. According to SAP Support, the only current alternative is to create different cost centers for each profit center and use those in Asset Accounting (AA).

Challenge:

Each cost center/profit center represents one of our locations. Our cost center structure is integrated across our organization (HR system, CRM, etc.). Creating a completely new cost center number is not a feasible option.

References checked:

  • Asset Accounting – Time-Dependent Master Data (SAP Help)

  • SAP Note 3576469 – Error message ‘Cost center has different profit centers’

Question:
Has anyone faced this or a similar scenario before? If so, how did you resolve it while keeping the cost center structure intact?

 

Thanks in advance for your support!

 

Best Regards,


Mike van Ingen
Finance

entry.title: Re: Tax Allowance in Depreciation for Malaysia
entry.content:
Hello @S0027169027 

Thank you for your follow-up,

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, it is recommended to use the standard depreciation keys provided for book purposes. Meanwhile, Malaysia’s capital allowance should be managed separately within the Local Tax depreciation area, specifically Depreciation Area 15.

Since custom depreciation keys cannot be generated in Public Cloud, the advised approach is:

  • Ensure book depreciation aligns with standard keys.
  • Manually post the 20% Initial Allowance in the first year using the Post Depreciation app.
  • Record the 10–20% Annual Allowance in subsequent years in a similar manner.

This ensures compliance with Malaysia’s capital allowance regime while maintaining the system's clean core and clearly separating book and tax values.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Quation Method Currency Exchange Rates
entry.content:
Hi, 

We have a customer who has been running on public cloud since June 2025.

They are now encountering issues during revaluation due to the use of indirect/direct quotation of exchange rates, as the calculation is not exactly the same. I'm wondering if we could change the quotation method from indirect to direct, even though they have already been using the system for a while? Or is this a change that cannot be made, considering they already have a large number of transactions in their system?

Thanks in advance, 

Sanne

entry.title: Accelerating Industry 4.0 roadmap with SAP intelligent best practices across 4 strategic ROI pillars
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP’s Industry 4.0 strategy & intelligent best practices empowers companies to evolve from isolated manufacturing automation to a holistic, competitive business strategy. On 6 November, we’ll showcase the latest SAP intelligent best practices within 4 strategic business value pillars, based on actual client use cases from e.g. Enexis, Swiss Railway, SBB. Each intelligent client use case (using AI / IoT) is designed to help businesses become more agile, resilient, customer-centric and profitable. These 4 strategic business value pillars are:

  1. Intelligent product & Solutions – Servitization – a key trend supported with “as-a-Service” models incl. solution bundles priced with “pay-per-use” subscription models, infused with Business AI & IoT in SAP private (BRIM) and public cloud (solution orders)
  2. Intelligent Factories & Supply Chain – AI-Driven Integrated Business Planning (IBP) with new AI enhancements across the business network and Edge devices.
  3. Intelligent Assets – OT/IT Enabled predictive maintenance (APM) AI strategies with the new market leading Cumulocity OT/IT edge platform.
  4. Intelligent collaborative Industry 4.0 Roadmap – Enexis roadmap for the next 18 months is Leading the Way to the future.

We’ll evaluate how these 4 strategic pillars contribute to an integrated Industry 4.0 roadmap to drive digital business transformation using the latest innovative SAP / AI / IoT platforms, SAP best practices and industry 4.0 solutions. The industry 4.0 roadmap can also be the basis for the benefits case of the S/4 HANA and GEN AI transformation program.

 

Pillar 1: Intelligent Products / Solutions = Servitization by outcome based solution bundles

Modern products are evolving into smart, customizable, and service-enabled solutions. SAP supports this servitization shift through two platforms:

  • SAP BRIM (Billing and Revenue Innovation Management) (based on SAP Cloud ERP Private)
  • SAP Cloud ERP (Public Cloud) incl. Solution Order and SAP Subscription Billing

The details of the client use case will be provided

 
Both platforms enable usage-based business models, bundling products and services into flexible offerings that drive recurring revenue and deeper customer engagement. Key topics covered:
  • Comparison of subscription-based billing options in SAP BRIM (private cloud) vs. SAP Cloud ERP (Solution Order) and SAP Subscription Billing (public cloud)
  • Business impact of Outcome-Based Contracts (OBCs), potentially increasing recurring revenue by 20–30%
  • The objectives of the SAP servitization strategy
  • Increased revenue by additional OPEX offerings and building long term customer relationships.

Further reading / information:

  • Solution Business Video
  • What is Solution Business - SAP News article
  • Solution Order Demo Video
  • Impact of Servitization on SAP Enterprise Architecture
  • Pay-per-Use and SAP Cloud Architecture
  • VNSG Round Table on Servitization Roadmaps
  • Impact SMART product configurators on enterprise architecture
  • Business Model Innovation Management in a SAP environment
  • Servitization round-table; Companies are struggling with their servitization roadmap
  • Servitization solution architecture workshop with SAP and Microsoft

Pillar 2: Intelligent Factories & Supply Chain = AI-Driven Integrated Business Planning

SAP’s Integrated Business Planning (IBP) transforms the digital supply chain agility into a competitive advantage.

 
A key AI feature is Inventory Optimization Analysis, which:
  • Summarizes key drivers behind safety stock recommendations
  • Highlights demand variability, lead time fluctuations, and planner deviations
  • Translates complex calculations into human-readable insights
  • Business networks to align the E2E supply chain
  • Benefits by increased SCM agility and reduced logistic costs

Benefits of the AI features:

  • Accelerates analysis and adoption of planning outputs
  • Aligns inventory decisions with strategic goals for working capital and customer service

The details of the Swiss Railway use case will be provided

Further reading:

  1. IBP for MRO Supply – VNSG Workshop
  2. Smart Factory Solution Architecture – VNSG Workshop
  3. Impact of the digital twin on the Solution architecture

Pillar 3: Intelligent Assets = IT/OT Edge-Enabled predictive maintenance strategies

SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) empowers EAM companies to shift from reactive to predictive maintenance strategies. By leveraging AI and IoT sensor data, APM helps minimize asset failure risks and enables faster, more accurate decision-making.

 
To support this transformation, SAP is embedding the market leading Cumulocity OT/IT edge platform into APM, enabling:
  • Simplified connectivity to diverse IoT data sources—smart sensors, edge devices, data lakes, flat files, and more
  • Advanced device management directly within SAP APM
  • Real-time asset health monitoring using AI and rule-based anomaly detection from streaming sensor data

The integration of SAP AI Core further enhances predictive maintenance by detecting anomalies in equipment behavior—without requiring data science expertise. Reliability engineers can deploy AI models that learn from historical sensor data and generate alerts for potential failures.

Real-world examples of anomaly detection include:

  • Beverage production line: filling valve failures
  • Mining operations: clogged air filters on trucks
  • Oil & gas: electric motor anomalies on rotating equipment

The details of the Bayer use case will be provided

Further reading:

  1. SAP APM + Cumulocity Integration
  2. VNSG AI Congress – Industry 4.0 at the Edge
  3. Impact of the digital twin on the Solution architecture
  4. The integration platform within a hybrid application landscape

Pillar 4 Industry 4.0 platform at Enexis = Utilities Leading the Way

On 6 November, the Enexis innovation team will present a deep dive into their R&D initiatives, showcasing how digital innovation is accelerating the transition to a smarter, faster, and more sustainable energy system.

 
The multidisciplinary team at Enexis is building and testing impactful digital solutions that directly influence the SAP solution architecture and AI roadmap.What to expect:
  • Hands-on demos of prototypes like BMR 2.0 and XR applications
  • Initiatives such as Digital4All, the AI Speeltuin, and the Roboticalab
  • Smart use of computer vision and Generative AI
  • End-to-end process automation and secure document access via the Enexis Document Store
  • Integrated SAP solution architecture and AI roadmap

Further reading:

  1. VNSG Focus Group – Intelligent Industry 4.0 Roadmap
  2. LinkedIn Updates – Enexis Innovation

Getting Started with Industry 4.0 roadmap

SAP offers a comprehensive portfolio of services to simplify and accelerate your Industry 4.0 journey. These include:

  • Libraries of best practices and preconfigured industry 4.0 solutions
  • Flexible deployment options and integrated business content
  • Regional Innovation Hubs with live factory setups to visualize high-value use cases

These resources help organizations across industries turn Industry 4.0 ambitions into tangible outcomes. Supported by an Enterprise Architecture Framework, AI data governance and Value Lifecycle management.

Further reading:

  1. Industry 4.0: The Future of Manufacturing | SAP
  2. SAP Industry 4.0 Strategy Overview
  3. The impact of Industry 4.0 on the enterprise architecture
  4. Solution Architecture 4 Agile SAP S/4 HANA platform

Enroll at VNSG site; www.vnsg.nl (events)

Like IT when you like IT

entry.title: 'Build Your First App with CAP' bookshop tutorial : Deploy to BTP Cloud Foundry fails (mbt build)
entry.content:
Hi,

I was following the jumpstart bookshop tutorial 'Build Your First App with CAP':
https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/get-started/in-a-nutshell#jumpstart

After I got a workaround for a bug of the Fiori bookshop sample (see https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/cap-build-your-first-app-with-cap-bookshop-tutorial-sap-fiori-ui-does-not/qaq-p/14231262), I have the bookshop sample running on localhost.

Now I want to deploy the full-stack CAP application on BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime, as described here:
https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf

Steps I followed:

  1. Prerequisites, all done => https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf#prerequisites
  2. Prepare for Production, steps below done => https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf#prepare-for-production
    • Step 1. (cds add hana)
    • Step 2. (cds add xsuaa)
    • Step 3. (cds add mta)
    • Step 5. (cds add workzone)
  3. Build and Deploy section => https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf#build-and-deploy
    • cf login step, done
    • cds up => this command resulted in the following error (entire console output at the bottom in [1])

npm error Missing script: "build"
npm error
npm error To see a list of scripts, run:
npm error npm run

Command failed: mbt build -t gen --mtar mta.tar

The "mbt build" works if I skip step 5. (cds add workzone) in the above 'Prepare for Production' steps

entry.title: coming soon: Sales Processes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION:

The first Activity of this Academic Lesson introduces the basic B2B order-to-cash processes and demonstrates how an ERP system facilitates these processes. The Learning Journey of this Activity also explains the foundational concepts of cloud computing. The second Activity dives deeper into how typical sales transactions are processed in an ERP, specifically SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and how AI assists in the day-to-day sales processes and analysis.  

SUGGESTED AREAS OF STUDY:

Business (all majors), Information Systems, and other areas of study that teach sales processes or ERP systems. Appropriate for students at undergraduate and graduate level university, community college, trade school and upper-level secondary school.  

KEYWORDS:

Sales processes, business processes, business transactions, ERP, SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Cloud computing, risk assessment, embedded AI

DOWNLOAD:

Microsoft Word (editable) format: coming soon 

PDF (non-edible) format: coming soon

UPDATED:  September 2025

entry.title: Exploring CDS based Analytical Models with the Relation Explorer - analytical view/perspective
entry.content:
Relation explorer analytical view / analytical perspective makes it easy to get an overview of the analytical model with very less clicks. No need to open all the views to understands details.

We start small , looking to a branch of a star schema , dimension Connection ( /DMO/ANA_I_Connection ) which is part of the flight data model.  After calling the relation explorer we see the Relation Explorer Tab in the below section of the screenshot.

Relation Explorer tab shows:

  • in the left pane the associations from the dimension to other CDS views over all levels are visualizes . It starts fully expanded!
    next to the CDS view name we see the view type. E.g. /DMO/ANA_I_CARRIER is of type [Dimension]
  • in the right pane one can see all the elements of current view. As /DMO/ANA_I_Connection is selected all elements of this dimension are displayed.
    • One can select (single click) any other view e.g. /DMO/ANA_I_CARRIER and the right pane get updated with the elements of that view.
    • double clicking the view will directly open the view 
  • the right pane displays all elements grouped by roles.
    • In this example we have 2 keys and e.g. expanding AirlineID show label and additional details about association and InfoObject. In case of compounded parent we would have seen the Parent element.
    • double clicking AirlineID highlight the element in the source ( see line 21 )
    • [Text] gives a hint that AirlineID has text, this is missing for ConnetionID -> no Text supported
    • Attributes list all dimension attributes. Last one, DistanceUnit is a Unit element.
    • the Unit group show all unit related elements.
    • other group are shown if relevant.

One can also start the analytical Relation Explorer based on query or cube view.
In both cases the cube view is opened and visualizes the cube with all associations .

We change focus and look to the example of a query - starting relation explorer shows the cube definition including dimension Connection from above.

with one view

  • in the left pane we get all associations visualizes. View names are shown with the view types
  • in the right pane we can see all 13 dimensions of the cube and get if dimension support Text, have Attributes or Hierarchies
    • from 1st screenshot we already know that Text, Attributes and Hierarchies are available for AirlineID
    • expanding ConnectionID show that it is compounded to AirlineID
  • we see all 5 measures with additional details like aggregation method and unit
  • with " Units (2) " we see the unit related dimensions. This section only list those dimension that are unit relevant.  Expanding the dimension like CurrencyCode lists all related measures. 
    ( Both dimension are also listed in dimension section. )
  • for time based dimension one can directly understand the base dimension and wherefrom it is derived without looking into the source ( see below snippet with FiscalYearMonth )

 

How to start the Relation Explorer

call relation explorer to see the view

right click somewhere in the CDS view 

( in case of CDS view type cube, dimension or query the analytical view is the default view )

  • If the view is not shown, choose Configure Context and activate it.
  • one can switch any time to different perspective / context if needed

 

 

 

Release Info:  analytical view / analytical perspective started with

  • BW/4HANA 2023 FP 04 
  • S/4HANA Public Cloud and Privat Cloud OP2023

entry.title: Crystal Reports Designer 2020 Showing Ruler in cm Page Setup in Inches
entry.content:
I've spent over an hour with both Copilot and Gemini AI and all state the same thing.  My Regional Format is set to United States.  My "Windows Display Language" is set to Canada.  Under control panel, Region, the format shows United States, Additional Settings shows Measurement System to to "U.S.".  

If I open ANY other application, the rulers are all imperial, which I want, since it's ingrained that a page is 8.5 inches.  

Why is Crystal confused as to what the measurements should be?  If the File > Page Setup shows "Inches" then should the ruler not match?  My windows display needs to be Canada and there are no other places to set measurement so Crystal is the issue.

entry.title: Re: Dive into the future of SAP Universal ID and understand the changes underway
entry.content:
Hello @bharatbajaj,

Please try the following steps to unlink the unnecessary identities:

  1. Under Identities tab, select the P-user which you would like to unlink from the UID account
  2. Click the three dots button in the top right window and then choose "Unlink Identity"
  3. Confirm the pop-up and the P-user should be unlinked.

entry.title: Re: Message and Header exchange from Child to Parent flows
entry.content:
Hi Aananda,

Sorry for the delay in response.

Thanks for the details. Now I understand that you are only experiencing this issue when the child flow fails. This is the intended behavior as the child process couldn't complete. Hence, details were not persisted. If you would like to propagate header as well as payload(custom exception) from exception subprocess to main iFlow, you need to replace Error end in exception subprocess to Message end.

The drawback of this approach would be that child iFlow would appear as Completed in message monitoring.

Thanks!

Kind regards,

Shweta
